description: Unique login identifier for the user; used to authenticate and audit their activity.
Indicates whether the user has administrative privileges across the system.
User’s full name or display name shown in the application.
User’s default company/business unit context for transactions and reporting; likely optional; confirm with SME.
User’s primary or home shop used to scope operations and defaults; likely the main working location; confirm with SME.
Employee/operator identifier linked to the user account; may be alphanumeric; confirm with SME.
Default storeroom/location for parts inventory activities performed by the user.
Default warehouse or issuing shop for inventory-related transactions by the user.
Permission flag allowing the user to close records such as work orders or requests.
Permission flag allowing the user to reopen previously closed records.
Permission to enter or edit pricing on parts, labor, or services.
Permission to enter or edit quantities on inventory or work transactions.
Default company context applied when working with equipment records.
Default company context applied when creating or updating work orders.
Default company context applied to fuel transactions and reporting.
Permission to override or manually adjust meter/odometer readings during entry.
Permission to close repair jobs or repair-related work orders.
Enables mass logoff functionality in Shop Management (e.g., for multiple mechanics or tasks); likely; confirm with SME.
Controls whether notes entered by the user are exclusive/private; likely a visibility/locking setting; confirm with SME.
Allows the user to set or change the department on work orders; behavior may be automatic or manual; confirm with SME.
Default warehouse status context used by the user in inventory processes; likely controls access to active vs. closed locations; confirm with SME.
